docs.lead_paragraph: We hope and believe it is a good sign that the question of Cookery is so often brought before the attention of the readers of newspapers of late. A question which is brought home to all of us, as we trust, two or three times every day, is one that will bear discussion, and a discussion that should bear fruit. headline.main: Why the Commissioners of Emigration refused the Seguine's Point Accommodations..

docs.lead_paragraph: At the last meeting of the Commissioners of Emigration, Mr. GARRIGUE made the following exposition of the reason, why the Board declined to receive from the Quarantine Commissioners the temporary Hospital accommodations at Seguine's Point: Mr. PRESIDENT--I rise on behalf of the Committee on the Removal of Quarantine, to a question of privilege.

headline.main: THE LOWBER CLAIM.; Judge Peabody's Order of Injunction and the Affidavits. The Corporation Counsel's Reasons for Refusing to Defend the City, SPECIAL MEETING OF THE ALDERMEN. They Would Compel Comptroller Flagg to Pay, Postponement of the Sale of City Property.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday was the day to which the sale had been postponed of the personal property of the City to satisfy an execution issued on the 12th of June in favor of ROBERT W. LOWBER, Esq., for $196,000 and costs. But the sale did not come off. It had been anticipated and stopped by an injunction. The order of Judge PEABODY, and the affidavits upon which the order was made, we give in full below.
docs.abstract: The Sale under his claim enjoined

docs.lead_paragraph: The Arabia, at this port last evening. brings three days' later news from Europe. No later intelligence is received from India. The English papers are filled with detailed accounts of the atrocities committed by the insurgents, but no particulars of importance are furnished in addition to those already published. The mutiny continued to create anxiety, and the Government had chartered vessels for the conveyance of troops to India.

headline.main: AMERICAN SLAVERY.; A Vindication of Slavery in Reply to the ReMonstrance. A Remonstrance from Geneva against Slavery.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following documents will be read with interest: TO THE EVANGELICAL CHRISTIANS OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. Dearly beloved Brethren in Christ, our all-sufficient Santeur and Common Head: The Evangelical Christians of Geneva frequently return thanks to God for having, in the days of CALVIN, lighted that torch in their city, whose salutary light has spread throughout Europe and reached your far-distant shores.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Rise in Consols, 90 5.8--Money Market Easier--Cotton steady. ARRIVAL OF THE ARABIA. NOTHING NEW FROM INDIA OR TURKEY.. BREADSTUFFS DULL. The Short-Cable Landed at Valentia. Arrival of the Emperor and Express of France in England. Progress of the Telegraphic Expedition. The Fleet Under Way for Newfoundland.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Arabia, Captain Stone, from Liverpool, at about 11 o'clock morning of Saturday, the 8th August, arrived at this port at 5 o'clock yesterday afternoon. The steamship Arxgo arrived at Southampton on the morning of Thursday, the 6th.

docs.lead_paragraph: The great excitement of yesterday was the sudden arrival of the steamer Tennessee, from Greytown, having on board 260 deserters from the army of Gen. WALKER. These poor fellows accept. ed the invitation of the Costa Rican government, and took refuge in, its camp when WALKER'S case had become hopeles.
